definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: She had too little faith in mankind not to know that they were erring .
sentences.chinese: 她对男人们没有信心，知道他们总要犯错误的。

sentences.english: Everyone makes mistakes, but few are incorrigible.
sentences.chinese: 人总是要犯错误的，但不可救药的却很少。

sentences.english: I finally decided that if I made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 最后我作出了决定，如果要犯错误的话。

sentences.english: Mr. al-Zarqawi is the most wanted man in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 扎卡维是伊拉克通辑的要犯。

sentences.english: Two elders tell four people make a month before they have fled out - mod the zhuang.
sentences.chinese: 两位长老告诉四人要犯一个月之前就已经逃出梅庄了。

sentences.english: This is a kind of mistake men almost always make.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种男人们几乎总要犯的错误。

sentences.english: It is reported that three important criminals ran away from prison last night.
sentences.chinese: 据报道，有三名要犯昨夜越狱逃跑。

sentences.english: If you go on like this, you'll make big mistakes some day.
sentences.chinese: 如果你继续这样下去势必有一天要犯大错误。

sentences.english: Don't make the mistake of one Accounting Manager I knew.
sentences.chinese: 不要犯和我认识的一位财务经理同样的错误。

sentences.english: Hopefully, you won't make the above mistakes...
sentences.chinese: 希望那时，你不要犯上面的错误。

sentences.english: They are doomed to make the same mistakes in the future.
sentences.chinese: 他们将来注定要犯同样的错误。

definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)
to order the arrest of sb as criminal/to list as wanted
to break the law/to commit a crime
